intro: Eurotia capensis, commonly known as the Cape dandelion, is a perennial herb native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its bright yellow flowers appear in late winter to early spring, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Eurotia capensis is adapted to arid conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
